questions.question: @`wotf activity is considered as active reconnaissance?
options: Browsing through the company's official website in search of employee email addresses.
Looking through an official job advertisement for a systems administrator position through the newspaper.
[]Perform social engineering by calling the IT helpdesk of the company, asking for a password reset for an important employee.
Running the WHOIS command on www.yahoo.com

questions.question: Which installation mode allows a user to quickly revert Kali Linux to the last known /working configuration should it be corrupted? Select the BEST answer.
@`wotf is NOT considered as a reconnaissance activity conducted by a hacker?
options: Gathering details on the CEO of a company using social media tools such as Linkedin.
Performing an NSlookup on the mail exchange server of a company.
[]Clearing all log entries in the event viewer of a compromised machine.
Running the command theharvester -d companyBel.com -b google > records.txt on the terminal.

questions.question: @`wotf BEST describes a Script Kiddie?
options: An expert programmer who creates his own Trojan/Backdoor program using Python.
A disgruntled HR manager who deletes all data on the HR systems upon receiving news that he will be fired.
[]An IT enthusiast who downloads sample malware from Github with the intention of testing it on a public server.
An IT expert who automates system backup procedures using PowerShell and Cron jobs.

questions.question: @`wotf is the MOST important aspect when conducting a penetration test?
options: []Receiving a formal written agreement stating the do's and don'ts during the penetration test.
Provide recommendations to fix the vulnerabilities
